sen.j: 唐古・鍵遺跡（からこ・かぎ・いせき）は奈良盆地中央部、標高約48メートル前後の沖積地、奈良県磯城郡田原本町大字唐古及び大字鍵に立地する弥生時代の環濠集落遺跡。
sen.e: The Karako Kagi Ruins are the remains of a Yayoi period moat-surrounded settlement located in Oaza-Karako and Oaza-Kagi, Taharamoto-cho, Shiki-gun, Nara Prefecture, which is an alluvial area about 48 meters in height in the central part of Nara basin.

The Karako Kagi Ruins are the remains of a Yayoi period moat-surrounded settlement located in Oaza-Karako and Oaza-Kagi, Taharamoto-cho, Shiki-gun, Nara Prefecture, which is an alluvial area about 48 meters in height in the central part of Nara basin.

The Karako Kagi Ruins are the remains of a Yayoi period moat-surrounded settlement located in Oaza-Karako and Oaza-Kagi, Taharamoto-cho, Shiki-gun, Nara Prefecture, which is an alluvial area about 48 meters in height in the central part of Nara basin.

sen.j: 現在知られている遺跡面積は約30万平方メートル。
sen.e: The area of the ruins known to date is about 300,000 square meters.
The area of the ruins known to date is about 300,000 square meters.
The area of the ruins known to date is about 300,000 square meters.

sen.j: 規模の大きさのみならず、大型建物の跡地や青銅器鋳造炉など工房の跡地が発見され、話題となった。
sen.e: In addition to its big scale, the area got into the news after the discovery of the sites where large-scale buildings and workshops such as bronze ware casting furnaces were.
In addition to its big scale, the area got into the news after the discovery of the sites where large-scale buildings and workshops such as bronze ware casting furnaces were.
In addition to its big scale, the area got into the news after the discovery of the sites where large-scale buildings and workshops such as bronze ware casting furnaces were.

sen.j: 平成11年（1999年）に国の史跡に指定され、ここから出土した土器に描かれていた多層式の楼閣が遺跡内に復元されている。
sen.e: In 1999 it was designated as a national historical spot, and a multistory tower drawn on unearthed earthen vessels are restored in the ruins.
In 1999 it was designated as a national historical spot, and a multistory tower drawn on unearthed earthen vessels are restored in the ruins.
In 1999 it was designated as a national historical spot, and a multistory tower drawn on unearthed earthen vessels are restored in the ruins.

sen.j: 全国からヒスイや土器などが集まる一方、銅鐸の主要な製造地でもあったと見られ、弥生時代の日本列島内でも重要な勢力の拠点があった集落ではないかと見られている。
sen.e: The site is regarded as a place where jades and earthen vessels across the country were carried in, a main place where bronze bell-shaped vessels were produced and a settlement which had bases of important powers among Japanese Islands in the Yayoi period.

The site is regarded as a place where jades and earthen vessels across the country were carried in, a main place where dotaku (bronze bell-shaped vessels) were produced and a settlement which had bases of important powers among Japanese Islands in the Yayoi period.

The site is regarded as a place where jades and earthen vessels across the country were carried in, a main place where dotaku (bronze bell-shaped vessels) were produced and a settlement which had bases of important powers among Japanese Islands in the Yayoi period.

sen.j: 集落の形成
sen.e: Formation of Settlements
Formation of Settlements
Formation of Settlements

sen.j: 遺跡北部・西部・南部の小高い丘に居住域が形成される。
sen.e: Resident areas were formed on low hills to the north/west/south of the ruins.
Resident areas were formed on low hills to the north/west/south of the ruins.
Resident areas were formed on low hills to the north/west/south of the ruins.

sen.j: 各居住区はおよそ150×300メートルの範囲を有していた。
sen.e: Each resident area was about 150 x 300 meters wide.
Each resident area was about 150 x 300 meters wide.
Each resident area was about 150 x 300 meters wide.

sen.j: そこからは、多数の鍬や鋤の農耕具、斧の柄などの工具、高杯や鉢などの容器類の各種未製品の木製品が多数検出された。
sen.e: A lot of farming tools such as hoes and plows, industrial tools such as ax handles, various unfinished wooden containers such as high cups and pots were found in this area.
A lot of farming tools such as hoes and plows, industrial tools such as ax handles, various unfinished wooden containers such as high cups and pots were found in this area.
A lot of farming tools such as hoes and plows, industrial tools such as ax handles, various unfinished wooden containers such as high cups and pots were found in this area.

sen.j: この期の石包丁の石材は遺跡の南方6キロにある耳成山からの流紋岩であった。
sen.e: Stone knives in this period were made of rhyolite taken from Mt. Miminashi-yama, 6 km away to the south of the ruins.
Stone knives in this period were made of rhyolite taken from Mt. Miminashi-yama, 6 km away to the south of the ruins.
Stone knives in this period were made of rhyolite taken from Mt. Miminashi-yama, 6 km away to the south of the ruins.

sen.j: 原石から石包丁までの製作の過程のものが出土している。
sen.e: Things showing from raw stones to stone knives in the process of production have been excavated.
Things showing from raw stones to stone knives in the process of production have been excavated.
Things showing from raw stones to stone knives in the process of production have been excavated.

sen.j: このようなことから、この集落の形成時期から様々な道具を造り、その周辺の地域に供給する集落であったと推定されている。
sen.e: The remains of a large-size all-pillar building, the oldest for the Yayoi period were found.
From this, it is estimated that various tools were built from the time when this settlement was formed and the settlement provided the tools to the surrounding areas.
From this, it is estimated that various tools were built from the time when this settlement was formed and the settlement provided the tools to the surrounding areas.

sen.j: 弥生時代としてはもっとも古い総柱の大形建物跡が検出されている。
sen.e: The remains of a large-size all-pillar building, the oldest for the Yayoi period were found.
The remains of a large-size all-pillar building, the oldest for the Yayoi period were found.
The remains of a large-size building on stilts, the oldest for the Yayoi period were found.

sen.j: この建物は、西地区の中枢建物と推定。
sen.e: This building is presumed to have been the central building in the west zone.
This building is presumed to have been the central building in the west zone.
This building is presumed to have been the central building in the west zone.

sen.j: 集落の分立（中期初頭）
sen.e: Separation of Settlements (Early Middle Period)
Separation of Settlements (Early Middle Period)
Separation of Settlements (Early Middle Period)

sen.j: 3か所の居住域周辺に環濠集落が巡らされる。
sen.e: Moat-surrounded settlements were built in the neighborhood of the three resident areas
Moat-surrounded settlements were built in the neighborhood of the three resident areas
Moat-surrounded settlements were built in the neighborhood of the three resident areas

sen.j: 西部居住域で大型建物の建築。
sen.e: A large-size building was constructed in the west resident area.
A large-size building was constructed in the west resident area.
A large-size building was constructed in the west resident area.

sen.j: 集落の統合（中期中葉）
sen.e: Integration of the Settlements (Middle Middle Period)
Integration of the Settlements (Middle Middle Period)
Integration of the Settlements (Middle Middle Period)

sen.j: 3か所の居住域の周りに大環濠を掘削し、一つの居住域に統合する。
sen.e: A big loop-moat was dug out around the three resident areas and they were integrated into one resident area.
A big circular moat was dug out around the three resident areas and they were integrated into one resident area.
A big circular moat was dug out around the three resident areas and they were integrated into one resident area.

sen.j: （長径約500メートル、短径約400メートルの不整円形）
sen.e: (an irregular circle 500 meters in the major axis and 400 meters in the minor axis)
(an irregular circle 500 meters in the major axis and 400 meters in the minor axis)
(an irregular circle 500 meters in the major axis and 400 meters in the minor axis)

sen.j: 内側の環濠は幅8メートル以上、その大環濠を囲むように幅4~5メートルの環濠が4~5重に巡らされる多重環濠。
sen.e: There are one inner loop moat more than eight meters in width and four to five outer loop moats four to five meters in width.
There are one inner circular moat more than eight meters in width and four to five outer circular moats four to five meters in width.
There are one inner circular moat more than eight meters in width and four to five outer circular moats four to five meters in width.

sen.j: これらの多重環濠群は居住区の外縁を幅150～200メートルで囲み、環濠帯を形成している。
sen.e: The group of these multiple loop-moats encloses the outside edge of the resident areas 150 to 200 meters in width, forming a loop-moat zone.
The group of these multiple circular moats encloses the outside edge of the resident areas 150 to 200 meters in width, forming a circular moat zone.
The group of these multiple circular moats encloses the outside edge of the resident areas 150 to 200 meters in width, forming a circular moat zone.

sen.j: 各居住区の内部は未調査であるが、村の西南部に河内や近江、紀伊など各地の搬入土器が多く出土する市的な場所、また、南部では木器の未成品や青銅器鋳造関連遺物や炉跡、北部ではサヌカイトの原石や剥片が纏まって出土する所などがあり、各種工人の居住の場所と推定される。
sen.e: The inside of each resident area remains uninvestigated, but these regions are presumed to have been living spaces for various craftworkers from the fact that in the southwest of the village there is a market-like place where earthen vessels carried in from Kawach, Omi, Ki and so on were found, in the south a place where unfinished wooden cups, remains related to bronze ware casting and remains of furnaces were found and in the north a place where raw stones of sanukite and their fragments were found in clusters.

The inside of each resident area remains uninvestigated, but these regions are presumed to have been living spaces for various craftworkers from the fact that in the southwest of the village there is a market-like place where earthen vessels carried in from Kawach, Omi, Ki and so on were found, in the south a place where unfinished wooden cups, remains related to bronze ware casting and remains of furnaces were found and in the north a place where raw stones of sanukite and their fragments were found in clusters.

The inside of each resident area remains uninvestigated, but these regions are presumed to have been living spaces for various craftworkers from the fact that in the southwest of the village there is a market-like place where earthen vessels carried in from Kawach, Omi, Ki and so on were found, in the south a place where unfinished wooden cups, remains related to bronze ware casting and remains of furnaces were found and in the north a place where raw stones of sanukite and their fragments were found in clusters.

sen.j: 南地区の中央部に高床建物がたっていた可能性が高く、中枢部と考えられる。
sen.e: It is highly possible that there was a high floor building in the south area, which can be regarded as the most important area.
It is highly possible that there was a high floor building in the central portion of the south area, which can be regarded as the most important area.
It is highly possible that there was a high floor building in the central portion of the south area, which can be regarded as the most important area.

sen.j: このようなことから大環濠内では、各種の機能別に区画されていたと考えられている。
sen.e: These things suggest that in the big loop-moat areas compartments were made functionally.
These things suggest that in the big circular moat areas compartments were made functionally.
These things suggest that in the big circular moat areas compartments were made functionally.

sen.j: 中期後半
sen.e: Late Middle Period
Late Middle Period
Late Middle Period

sen.j: 楼閣などの建物・動物・人物の絵画を土器に描く風習の確認。
sen.e: A custom of drawing buildings such as towers, animals and persons on earthen vessels was verified.
A custom of drawing buildings such as towers, animals and persons on earthen vessels was verified.
A custom of drawing buildings such as towers, animals and persons on earthen vessels was verified.

sen.j: 洪水により環濠が埋没。
sen.e: The loop-moats were buried because of a flood.
The circular moats were buried because of a flood.
The circular moats were buried because of a flood.

sen.j: 集落の発展
sen.e: Development of the Settlements
Development of the Settlements
Development of the Settlements

sen.j: 中期後半から末にかけての洪水後に環濠再掘削が行われ、環濠帯の広さも最大規模となる。
sen.e: From the latter half of the middle period to the last period loop-moats were dug out again after floods and the loop-moat area reached a maximum size.
From the latter half of the middle period to the last period circular moats were dug out again after floods and the circular moat area reached a maximum size.
From the latter half of the middle period to the last period circular moats were dug out again after floods and the circular moat area reached a maximum size.

sen.j: 洪水で埋没したにもかかわらず、この期に再建された。
sen.e: The moats buried by the flood were reconstructed at this period.
The moats buried by the flood were reconstructed at this period.
The moats buried by the flood were reconstructed at this period.

sen.j: ここに唐古・鍵遺跡の特質がみられる。
sen.e: This is the characteristic of Karako Kagi Ruins.
This is the characteristic of Karako Kagi Ruins.
This is the characteristic of Karako Kagi Ruins.

sen.j: 集落南部で青銅器の製作。
sen.e: Bronze ware was produced in the southern district of the settlement.
Bronze ware was produced in the southern district of the settlement.
Bronze ware was produced in the southern district of the settlement.

sen.j: 集落の衰退
sen.e: Decline of the Settlements
Decline of the Settlements
Decline of the Settlements

sen.j: 大環濠の消滅。
sen.e: Disappearance of Large Loop Moats.
Disappearance of Large Circular Moats.
Disappearance of Large Circular Moats.

sen.j: 環濠の一部再掘削。
sen.e: Re-digging up of a part of loop moats.
Re-digging up of a part of circular moats.
Re-digging up of a part of circular moats.

sen.j: 弥生時代を通しての環濠集落を放棄したにもかかわらず、古墳時代の初めに再度環濠集落をも形成する。
sen.e: Through the Yayoi period the moat-surrounded settlements were abandoned, they were formed again in the early Kofun period.
Through the Yayoi period the moat-surrounded settlements were abandoned, they were formed again in the early Kofun period.
Through the Yayoi period the moat-surrounded settlements were abandoned, they were formed again in the early Kofun period.

sen.j: ここに唐古・鍵遺跡の特徴があると、考えられている。
sen.e: This is regarded as a feature of Karako Kagi Ruins.
This is regarded as a feature of Karako Kagi Ruins.
This is regarded as a feature of Karako Kagi Ruins.

sen.j: 弥生時代前期と同様に、三個所の地区（西・北・南）を中心に居住遺構が検出されている。
sen.e: Same as in the early Yayoi period, residence remains have been found mostly in three areas (west/north/south).
Same as in the early Yayoi period, residence remains have been found mostly in three areas (west/north/south).
Same as in the early Yayoi period, residence remains have been found mostly in three areas (west/north/south).

sen.j: 次の時期には遺構数も増加する傾向にある。
sen.e: In the following periods the number of remains also shows the tendency to increase.
In the following periods the number of remains also shows the tendency to increase.
In the following periods the number of remains also shows the tendency to increase.

sen.j: 井戸などの遺構が減少していることから、居住域が規模が縮小していることがわかる。
sen.e: Decreased remains such as wells show the contraction of the resident areas.
Decreased remains such as wells show the contraction of the resident areas.
Decreased remains such as wells show the contraction of the resident areas.

sen.j: 集落の消滅
sen.e: Disappearances of the Settlements
Disappearances of the Settlements
Disappearances of the Settlements

sen.j: 遺跡中央部に前方後円墳が造られ、墓域となる。
sen.e: With the building of a zenpokoenfun (large-scale keyhole-shaped tomb) in the center of the ruins, it became a grave area.
With the building of a zenpokoenfun (large-scale keyhole-shaped tomb) in the center of the ruins, it became a grave area.
With the building of a zenpokoenfun (large-scale keyhole-shaped tomb) in the center of the ruins, it became a grave area.

sen.j: 中世
sen.e: Middle Ages
Middle Ages
Middle Ages

sen.j: 唐古氏・唐古南氏・唐古東氏の居館がつくられる。
sen.e: Residences of the Karako, Karakominami, and Karakohigashi clans were built.
Residences of the Karako, Karakominami, and Karakohigashi clans were built.
Residences of the Karako, Karakominami, and Karakohigashi clans were built.

sen.j: 唐古南氏の居館周辺は、現在の鍵集落へと発展。
sen.e: The area around the Karakominami clan's residence developed into the present the Kagi settlement.
The area around the Karakominami clan's residence developed into the present the Kagi settlement.
The area around the Karakominami clan's residence developed into the present the Kagi settlement.

sen.j: 江戸時代
sen.e: Edo Period
Edo Period
Edo Period

sen.j: 唐古・鍵池が造られる。
sen.e: Karako Kagi pond was built.
Karako Kagi pond was built.
Karako Kagi pond was built.

sen.j: 遺跡周辺が水田となる。
sen.e: The area around the ruins turned into rice fields.
The area around the ruins turned into rice fields.
The area around the ruins turned into rice fields.

sen.j: 弥生時代中期初頭の大型建物跡を検出。
sen.e: Remains of a large-size building in the early middle Yayoi period were discovered.
Remains of a large-size building in the early middle Yayoi period were discovered.
Remains of a large-size building in the early middle Yayoi period were discovered.

sen.j: 銅鐸の工房跡ではないかとみられる弥生時代の青銅器鋳造炉跡の検出。
sen.e: Remains of a large-size building in the early middle Yayoi period were discovered.
Remains of a large-size building in the early middle Yayoi period, which can be seen as remains of dotaku workshop were discovered.
Remains of a large-size building in the early middle Yayoi period, which can be seen as remains of dotaku workshop were discovered.

sen.j: 北地区から弥生時代前期の木棺墓を2基検出。
sen.e: In the northern zone two mokkanbo tombs in the early Yayoi period were discovered.
In the northern zone two mokkanbo tombs in the early Yayoi period were discovered.
In the northern zone two mokkanbo tombs in the early Yayoi period were discovered.

sen.j: 井戸跡
sen.e: Remains of wells
Remains of wells
Remains of wells

sen.j: 大環濠帯跡
sen.e: Remains of areas with big loop-moats
Remains of areas with big circular moats
Remains of areas with big circular moats

sen.j: 南地区東南部側の環濠付近から方形周溝墓、大環濠集落成立以前（弥生時代中期初期）。
sen.e: In the neighborhood of the loop-moat in the southeast side of the southern zone, a square-shaped loop-moat tomb, prior to the formation of large scale loop-moat settlements.
In the neighborhood of the circular moat in the southeast side of the southern zone, a square-shaped circular moat tomb, prior to the formation of large scale circular moat settlements.
In the neighborhood of the circular moat in the southeast side of the southern zone, a square-shaped circular moat tomb, prior to the formation of large scale circular moat settlements.

sen.j: 大阪府西部・滋賀県南部・三重県から愛知県西部・岡山県南部など各地の搬入土器が出土。
sen.e: Unearthed clay vessels were carried in from various places such as western Osaka Prefecture, southern Shiga Prefecture, Mie Prefecture, western Aich Prefecture and southern Okayama Prefecture.
Clay vessels carried in from various places such as western Osaka Prefecture, southern Shiga Prefecture, Mie Prefecture, western Aich Prefecture and southern Okayama Prefecture, were unearthed.
Clay vessels carried in from various places such as western Osaka Prefecture, southern Shiga Prefecture, Mie Prefecture, western Aich Prefecture and southern Okayama Prefecture, were unearthed.

sen.j: 木棺墓１基から弥生人の成人男性の人骨を検出。
sen.e: In one mokkannbo tomb bones of a male adult in the Yayoi period was found.
In one mokkannbo (wooden coffin tomb), bones of a male adult in the Yayoi period was found.
sen.cmt: 木棺墓の補足説明を追加
sen.e: In one mokkannbo (wooden coffin tomb), bones of a male adult in the Yayoi period was found.

sen.j: 絵を描いた土器が多数出土。
sen.e: A lot of earthen vessels with pictures drawn on them were found.
A lot of earthen vessels with pictures drawn on them were unearthed.
A lot of earthen vessels with pictures drawn on them were unearthed.

sen.j: そのうちの二つの土器の破片に「楼閣」が描かれている。
sen.e: A "rokaku " is drawn on two fragments of these vessels.
A 'rokaku' is drawn on two fragments of these vessels.
A 'rokaku' is drawn on two fragments of these vessels.

sen.j: 楼閣とは、2階建て以上の高い建物のこと。
sen.e: A rokaku means a high building with more than two stories.
A rokaku means a high building with more than two stories.
A rokaku means a high building with more than two stories.

sen.j: 巻き込んだ屋根飾りを付けた建物が6棟あり、格式の高い建物である。
sen.e: There are six buildings with rolled roof decorations, and they are prestigious buildings.
There are six buildings with curved roof decorations, and they are prestigious buildings.
There are six buildings with curved roof decorations, and they are prestigious buildings.

sen.j: その中でも「楼閣」は巻き込んだ屋根飾りがたくさん付いているので一番格式の高い建物であることが推測できる。
sen.e: Among them the "rokaku" has a lot of rolled roof decorations, so it is presumed to be the most prestigious building.
Among them the "rokaku" has a lot of curved roof decorations, so it is presumed to be the most prestigious building.
Among them the "rokaku" has a lot of curved roof decorations, so it is presumed to be the most prestigious building.

sen.j: 建物の絵を描いた土器は西日本の各地で46例見つかっており、そのうち15例がこの遺跡から出土した土器で、屋根飾りを付けた建物の絵はこの遺跡で6例、隣村の清水風（天理市）で1例あるのみ。
sen.e: Forty-six earthen vessels on which pictures of buildings are drawn have been founded in various places in Western Japan; of them fifteen came out from these ruins and six vessels on which pictures of buildings with roof decorations are drawn were found in these ruins and only one in the neighboring village, Kiyomizukaze (Tenri City).

Forty-six earthen vessels on which pictures of buildings are drawn have been founded in various places in Western Japan; of them fifteen came out from these ruins and six vessels on which pictures of buildings with roof decorations are drawn were found in these ruins and only one in the neighboring village, Kiyomizukaze (Tenri City).

Forty-six earthen vessels on which pictures of buildings are drawn have been founded in various places in Western Japan; of them fifteen came out from these ruins and six vessels on which pictures of buildings with roof decorations are drawn were found in these ruins and only one in the neighboring village, Kiyomizukaze (Tenri City).

sen.j: 絵画土器 - 弥生土器にヘラ状の道具で描いた線刻画。
sen.e: Picture-drawn earthen vessels -line drawing carved on vessels with a spatulate tool.
Picture-drawn earthen vessels: line drawing carved on vessels with a spatulate tool.
sen.cmt: ハイフンをコロンに変更
sen.e: Picture-drawn earthen vessels: line drawing carved on vessels with a spatulate tool.

sen.j: 弥生時代後半、近畿地方を中心に出土する。
sen.e: They were found mainly in Kinki region in the latter half of the Yayoi period
They were found mainly in Kinki region in the latter half of the Yayoi period
They were found mainly in Kinki region in the latter half of the Yayoi period

sen.j: 最多出土が本遺跡で300点。
sen.e: Three hundred vessels, the largest number, were unearthed in these ruins.
Three hundred vessels, the largest number, were unearthed in these ruins.
Three hundred vessels, the largest number, were unearthed in these ruins.

sen.j: 次いで清水風遺跡約50点。
sen.e: Next come Kiyomizukaze Ruins, from which about 50 of them were excavated.
Next come Kiyomizukaze Ruins, from which about 50 of them were excavated.
Next come Kiyomizukaze Ruins, from which about 50 of them were excavated.

sen.j: 祭祀用の土器と考えられている。
sen.e: They are thought to have been earthen vessels for religious service.
They are thought to have been earthen vessels for religious service.
They are thought to have been earthen vessels for religious service.

sen.j: 水壺・酒壺などの液体貯蔵用土器に描かれている。
sen.e: Pictures are drawn on earthenware for storing liquid such as water jugs and sake jugs.
Pictures are drawn on earthenware for storing liquid such as water jugs and sake jugs.
Pictures are drawn on earthenware for storing liquid such as water jugs and sake jugs.

sen.j: 画題は、建物・人物・鹿など。
sen.e: Subjects of the paintings are buildings, persons, deer and so on.

sen.j: 大型勾玉が2個入った褐鉄鉱（かつてっこう）容器が出土。
sen.e: A limonite container containing two large magatama (comma-shaped gems) were found.
A limonite container containing two large magatama (comma-shaped gems) were found.

sen.j: 古墳の検出。
